document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

bibRefCitation.author: Raffray, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Raffray, A. (1904 a) Genera et catalogue des Pselaphides [continued]. Annales de la Societe Entomologique de France, 73, 1 - 400.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.

Characters/Description: Raffray 1904a: 369 (characters in key); Raffray 1908a: 358 (characters in key), 393 (characters); O. Park 1942: 296 (characters in key), 332 (characters); Hlaváč & Chandler 2005: 91 (characters in key).

bibRefCitation.author: Raffray, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Raffray, A. (1896 a) Notes synonymiques sur les Pselaphides. Annales de la Societe Entomologique de France, 65, 131 - 137.

subSubSection.paragraph: 7 species are known from and are restricted to Central and South America.
Key: Raffray 1905: 409 (species of the genus); O. Park 1942: 334 (species of the genus).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species:
Phalepsus hirsutus L.W. Schaufuss, 1886
Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.

Characters/Description: Raffray 1904a: 371 (characters in key); Raffray 1908a: 359 (characters in key), 403 (characters); O. Park 1942: 297 (characters in key), 338 (characters); Hlaváč & Chandler 2005: 90 (characters in key).

subSubSection.paragraph: 7 species are known from and are restricted to Latin America.
Central America: Honduras , Costa Rica , Panama .

Juxtahamotopsis O.
Park, 1942: 303
[synonymized by O.
Park et al. 1976: 66
]

subSubSection.paragraph:
5 species are known from and are restricted to the West Indies and Central America. Characters/Description: Raffray 1904a: 310 (characters in key); Raffray 1908a: 319 (characters in key), 326 (characters); O. Park 1942: 289 (characters), 296 (characters in key as
Juxtahamotopsis
); O.
Park et al. 1976: 66
(characters); Chandler 2002: 51 (characters in key); Hlaváč & Chandler 2005: 90 (characters in key). Key: O. Park 1942: 290 (species of the genus); O.
Park et al. 1976: 66
(species of the West Indies). Distribution. West Indies: Cuba , US Virgin Isl., Grenada . Central America: Nicaragua , Panama .

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to South America.

subSubSection.paragraph: 2 species are known from and are restricted to South America.
Characters/Description: O. Park 1942: 296 (characters in key); O. Park 1946b: 448 (characters); Borgmeier 1954: 204 (characters); Hlaváč & Chandler 2005: 91 (characters in key).

bibRefCitation.author: Aube, C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Aube, C. (1844) Revision de la famille des Pselaphiens. Annales de la Societe Entomologique de France (ser. 2), 2, 73 - 160, pl. 3.

subSubSection.paragraph: 97 species are included in this genus from Latin America.
West Indies: Montserrat , Guadeloupe , St. Vincent & Grenadines , Grenada , Trinidad-Tobago.
Central America: Mexico , Guatemala , Belize , Nicaragua , Costa Rica , Panama .
South America: Colombia , Venezuela , French Guiana , Ecuador , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Chile , Argentina .

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central America.
